Script
M-Cn: Hi, Ms. Millet. It’s Hector Diaz calling from Jackson Real Estate. An apartment has jus been listed that I think you might be interested in. It’s a one-bedroom place that’s available immediately. But best of all, it’s near Fulbright Park.
W-Am: Near Fulbright Park? Oh, that’s wonderful news. The park is very close to my office – that’s exactly what I’d hoped for.
M-Cn: Would you like to look at the apartment? We can get in to see it sometime tomorrow if you’re free.
W-Am: I’m busy in the morning, but the afternoon would be fine. Let me write down where it is, and I can meet you there.

question.text: What type of business does the man work for?
Why is the woman pleased?
choices: (B) A job position is opening soon.

question.text: What does the woman plan to do tomorrow afternoon?

answer.explanation:
W-Am: Hi, this is Margeret from Templeton Corporation. Q1 I’m calling about our catering order for this Friday. I know we agreed on a menu last week, but Q2 it is too late to change one of our selections?
M-Cn: Well, I’m glad you called. I was just about to get in touch with my vendor to order the supplies we’ll need for your event. What would you like to change?
W-Am: I’d like to switch the meat lasagna to the vegetarian lasagna. Some of my colleagues don’t eat meat, and I forgot about that when I was placing the order.
M-Cn: No problem. Q3 I’ll revise the order and e-mail you a new invoice to confirm the changes we’re making.

Why does the woman call the man?

answer.explanation:
W-Br: Ansel, Q1 how did this morning's marketing meeting go? You were going to ask for help with our department's workload, right?
M-Au: Yes! Q2 The company director agreed to increase our marketing department's budget by two hundred thousand dollars.
W-Br: That’s a big increase from last year! Do you know how that money will be used?
M-Au: Well, Q3 the department managers already agreed that most of the money will go towards hiring two new staff members. Having another artist and a digital advertising specialist would really help us deal with our workload.

question.text: What department do the speakers work in?
Why does the woman say, “That’s a big increase from last year”?
choices: (A) To indicate that some news is good
(B) To deny a requested budget change
(C)  To suggest that a fee is appropriate

answer.text: (A) To indicate that some news is good

question.text: According to the man, what do the department managers plan to do?

W-Am: Craig, Q1 I have to print copies of the quarterly earnings report for the board meeting next week. Have you made the updates to it yet?
M-Cn: I’m still working on some of the final figures. Q2 The accounting software was down for maintenance all day yesterday, so I'm a little behind. When do you need it by?
W-Am: By the end of the day, if possible. Q3 I have to pick up some board members at the airport on Monday morning, so I want to get the report finished up this week.

answer.explanation:
M: Q1 Hi Jennifer, this is Scott. Did you transfer some money to Mr. Woods yesterday? He called me today and said they haven’t received the funds yet. They are one of our most important clients and I don’t want to upset them.
W1: Grace, did you do it? I asked you to go to the bank yesterday and take care of it.
W2: Yes, I did it at about 4:00 P.M. Q2 The bank said it might take an extra business day to go through because they are having some problems with their computer system. Sorry, I should’ve told you.
M: I see. In the future, please let me know. This client is quite strict about time so we need to be careful not to upset them. They bring US a lot of business. Q3 I need you to e-mail me the transfer receipt so I can send them evidence of the payment.
W2: I’m sorry. I’ll email you the transfer receipt right away.

question.text: Why is the man calling Jennifer?
choices: (B) To transfer her to another department
(C) To ask about a money transfer

answer.text: (C) To ask about a money transfer

question.text: What does Grace say about the bank?
choices: (A) They were closed when she got there.
(B) They are having problems with their computers.

answer.text: (B) They are having problems with their computers.

M-Cn: Sinclair's sounds good, and I'm sure we can get a taxi there on Thursday. Q3 Let me call the restaurant now and see if I can get a reservation. If that doesn't work out, I'll try the Italian place.

W: Hi, Mr. Winston. This is Sharon Smith. Q1 I was the person interested in buying the used Speedster sports car that you showed me last week. I checked my financial situation and I’ve decided to go ahead with the purchase.
M: Hi, Ms. Smith. Well, unfortunately, we already sold that car to somebody yesterday. However, I have a similar model that you could look at. The car is used, but it is in great shape and just had new tires put on it.
W: Oh, that’s too bad that you already sold the model. Q2 That car had a really good safety rating, which is what I consider most important when buying a car.
M: I see. Well, this similar model also has a five-star safety rating. Q3 Why don’t you come here this week? You can take a look at it and take it for a test drive.

Script
W-Br: Hi, my name is Tomoko. Q1 I saw an advertisement for your motorcycle, and I’m interested in purchasing it. Q2 But I have a concern about the price. It’s a little high considering it’s a few years old. Could you lower the price by two hundred dollars? I also read in the ad that you’d be willing to drop the motorcycle off at the buyer’s house, but I live an hour away so I don’t want to make you drive too far. Q3 My friend and I can come pick it up on Saturday, if you accept my offer. Give me a call back tonight at 555-0108. Thanks.

question.text: Why is the speaker calling?
What does the speaker say she is concerned about?
What does the speaker offer to do?

answer.explanation: Welcome to this meeting of Mill City Parks Alliance. As you know, we’ve been working to create a park in the town center, but unfortunately, we’re still short on funds. We’ve received donations from some community groups to assist in buying trees to plant in the park, but we still need additional funds for purchasing playground equipment and benches. I think we should contact some local businesses to see if they'd be willing to make a donation. So what I’d like us to do now is come up with a list of shop and restaurant owners who might be interested in helping with this project.

question.text: What is the talk mainly about?
What problem does the speaker mention?
What are listeners asked to do?
choices: (C) Make a list of business owners

answer.text: (C) Make a list of business owners

Q2 An important merger will take place in April, and I need to be in New York in order to lead a meeting between my company and NX Electronics. Q3 Oh, and also, please let me know how much you expect to be compensated for babysitting. Thanks again.

Script
M-Au: This is Harold Rosen, with WKRN News, 74 reporting from the newly opened Bradford Opera House. 75 The building is ultramodern, and when plans for its construction were announced, locals expressed their concern about it. It’s located right next to historic city hall, the oldest building in the city. But so far, residents who have visited seem to like it. In spite of its modern look, those who have been inside are impressed. The atrium is beautifully decorated, the theather is equipped with a state-of-the-art sound system, and, of course, the music program is specutacular. 76 The schedule for this season’s performances can be found on the WKRN Web site.

question.text: Where is the speaker reporting from?
What deos the speaker imply when he says. "it's located right next to historic city hall, the oldest building in the city"?
choices: (A)An old building need to be repaired.
(C)A new building contrasts with older ones.
(D)A building is not difficult to get to.

answer.text: (C)A new building contrasts with older ones.

question.text: What can the listeners do on a web site?

answer.explanation: Good morning, everybody. I hope your time here as interns at our art gallery has been a good experience for you so far. Today I want you to help us publicize the upcoming photography exhibition. It's the latest collection of works by the artist Jettrin Sakda. So I’d like each of you to take two hundred fliers with you today and distribute them around the area. In addition to handing them out to pedestrians, you’ll be visiting hotels and other businesses that have agreed to display our fliers for us. Don’t worry, I’ll give you a map where I ve circled the places I want you to go. Please be back at the gallery at five P.M. See you later!

question.text: Where do the listeners work?
What will the listeners be doing today?

answer.explanation: Hi Mei-ling, this is Lee Sanders calling from Rose Avenue Properties. Q1 lt was great meeting you on Monday, and I hope you’re still considering renting the two-bedroom apartment I showed you. Q2 You also asked about parking in the garage next door, and I wanted to get back to you to let you know that there are a few spaces available. Anyway, this is a very popular building, so let me know what you want to do. That way, I can prepare all the necessary paperwork for the lease.

question.text: What did the speaker do on Monday?

choices: (C) It is accessible only to residents.
(D) It is usually full during the day.

question.text: Why does the speaker say, “this is a very popular building”?
choices: (B) To explain why a fee is expensive
(D) To request that more staff be hired

answer.explanation: Q1 I’m Alan Lam and you’re listening to Business Today on HK Radio One. Results of the National Manufacturers’ Association’s annual survey were released today. Q2 Nearly three out of four survey respondents indicated that having high-quality employees is the factor most critical to their success. The second most commonly selected factor was new product innovation. Most respondents noted that they must create innovative products in order to compete in the global marketplace. Q3 Surprisingly, low-cost production ranked third in the survey in the past, this has been the number one response, with manufacturers placing an emphasis on inexpensive operations. Now, it appears, executives are hoping to have high-quality employees and be innovative, too.

question.text: Who is Alan Lam?
Who responded to the survey?
How did the survey responses differ from those of previous years?

answer.explanation:

Hello, everyone. Welcome to the planning committee, which is in charge of overseeing the construction of a new elementary school here in Eagleton. I’m looking for someone to volunteer as the note taker during this meeting. His or her duty will be to keep track of what is debated. After this meeting, you will need to send a summary of it to all attendees. In order to perform this duty, he or she needs to be a detailed listener. But for now, I would like you to give personal introductions. That way, we can get to know each other better.

Hello, this is Sam Booth calling from Crimson Realty. This message is for Jordan King. I’m happy to say that someone is interested in making an offer on your house. I would like to stop by with the potential buyer this Thursday to discuss the sale in more detail. Please let me know what time on Thursday you’re available and I’ll arrange a time with the potential buyer. In the meantime, I suggest you clean up the house so it looks as impressive as possible for Thursday. Thank you.

question.text: Who most likely is the speaker?
Why would the speaker like to arrange a meeting?
What does the speaker suggest doing?

answer.explanation:
Transcript:
Welcome, spectators. Please listen to a short announcement before the match begins. As of today, you are no longer allowed to bring food and drinks from outside into the stadium. Please adhere to this new regulation. However, there are concession stands selling a variety of delicious snacks and beverages at reasonable prices. In addition, 5 percent of the proceeds made from concession stands will be donated to a charity that helps children with disabilities. Thank you.

question.text: Where is the announcement being made?
What is being announced?
What is said about some proceeds?
choices: (A) They will be used for a worthy cause.
(B) They will be put toward updating facilities.
(C) They will be saved for a special event.
(D) They will be awarded to some spectators.

answer.text: (A) They will be used for a worthy cause.

question.text: Due to his decades of experience, Mr. Finley was responsible for the training of the   _____   for the new gym.

answer.explanation: Need a noun after “the” =>choose A

question.text: To participate in the Advantage Discount program, ------- the registration form on your Web site.

answer.explanation: This is a vocabulary question, you need to base on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer

question.text: After his contract ___, he will have to look for a new job.

answer.explanation: (A) “Expires” means “ends”. Choices (B), (C), and (D) look similar to the correct answer but cannot be used in this context.

question.text: With the ___ of Internet-based recording software, the traditional music industry faces a challenge.

answer.explanation: Proliferation = Sudden increase

question.text: The new-product development meeting wiH be held either in Room 402 ___ in Room 501.

answer.explanation: Either…or…

question.text: Mr. Wagner will arrange the schedule of events for the ………………..of the flagship store.

answer.explanation:
Before the fill is "the", after the preposition is the preposition "of" à Need to fill in a noun => C and D are wrong.
based on the meaning, we choose A

question.text: The Neighborhood Involvement Program honors residents _____ volunteer their time to help Egin City.

answer.explanation:
"Who": Relational clauses refer to people
.. .residents có who volunteer time

question.text: The restrooms on the second floor are _____  unavailable because one of the sinks is being replaced.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=>A

question.text: Many voters in this city are uninterested, and only about 15% of them are  _____  active.

answer.explanation:
The blank is before the adjective "active" 
=> Need an adv to modify for adj

question.text: A  materials ___ for the upcoming seminar need to be copied at least two days in advance.
Entrepreneur James Mosby is featured in the most  _____ issue of the magazine.

answer.explanation:
A, B, D are wrong because they don't go with “the most”
=> Choose C

question.text: Brock’s Bistro has requested that we _______ the number of dinner guests by Monday.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words.

question.text: Rigon Communications, a leading telephone service provider, is ___ the most notable businesses featured in this month’s edition of Best Enterprises.

answer.explanation: The word "businesses" is plural so we referring to the company as a part of a group. Therefore, the answer is "among".

question.text: The latest version of the software___with your new computer.

answer.explanation: (B) Someone else included the software; use the past participle. Choice (A) is present tense. Choice (C) is present continuous. Choice (D) is past tense.

question.text: Comco, Inc,, became the leading supplier of computer ___ last year, less than ten years after it was founded.

answer.explanation: "Computer parts" suits the context the most.

question.text: By the time we got to the train station, the train___.

answer.explanation: (A) This is a past perfect verb used to describe an action that happened before another action (wegot to the station] in the past. Choice (B) is the right tense but is passive voice, and the sentence is active. Choice (C) is present perfect. Choice (D) is future perfect.

question.text: The novelist said that his writing was ______ influenced by the late writer Edward Truitt.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of adverbs => profoundly modifies best the verb "influenced"
=> Choose D

question.text: Weekly  _____  of the facility help to ensure that minor maintenance issues are discovered and resolved early.

answer.explanation:
The blank precedes preposition "of" => use a noun
=> Choose A

question.text: Sassen Motors’ newest car features a stylish dashboard design and a ___ interior.

answer.explanation: Spacious = Having a lot of space

question.text: A ___ number of technical service requests from users prompted Hisocom Corporation to upgrade its Internet servers.

answer.explanation: Significant = Great

question.text: During the music festival, goods will be sold only by _____  vendors who have registered with the planners.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of words
=> Choose D

question.text: ________ in the news, the Honorable Cynthia Rengle is now making headlines with her proposal to drastically reduce local taxes.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words.

question.text: New paint ___ pictures will make the office look better.

answer.explanation: (B) “Paint” and “pictures” are equal items joined with “and”. Choices (A), (C), and (D) join clauses, not nouns.

question.text: Through his extensive research into acquiring language skills, Dr. Harvey Ward has proven ______ to be a leader in the field.

answer.explanation:
use reflexive pronoun to indicate Dr. Harvey Ward
=> Choose C

question.text: Gessen Contractors guarantees customers top-quality handiwork on every job, ------- of how small.

answer.explanation: By phrase "regardless of"

question.text: The figures that accompany the financial statement should be _____ to the spending category.

answer.explanation:
The blank is after be so we can use an adjective or a noun. In the answers given, between A and D, we have D that is suitable in the meaning
be relevant to: to connected with what is happening or being discussed
=>Choose D

question.text: A customer service representative ___ at our catalogue number.

answer.explanation: (B) “Always” should come between the auxiliary and the main verb. In Choice (A) “always” is before the verb. In Choice (C) “always” is after the main verb. Choice (D) uses the wrong form of be.

question.text: To ensure that all deadlines are met, Ms. Sharma has asked team leaders to provide her with ___ project updates.

answer.explanation:
Update = Recent report/information
The word "updates" relates to time or frequency so we choose "frequent".

question.text: The occupancy rate at Starburst Hotel has ______  by 24% due to increased competition.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer
=> B

question.text: Marburg Electro Company is ___ to report a significant increase in profits for the year.

answer.explanation: Be expected to do st = May do st in the future

question.text:
To: saul_ortega@jmail.net
From: k_morris@tknmanufacturing.com
Date: October 18
Subject: Factory Manager position

Dear Mr. Ortega,
You are officially invited to a second interview. This time, I will be meeting only with the top candidates to determine who is most (1) _____ for the manager position. I believe you possess many of the (2) _____ we are looking for.
I trust that you remain interested in this job opportunity. (3) _____ , would a 1:00 P.M. appointment next Tuesday work for you? Please prepare a proposal that explains how you would increase production at our plant without decreasing quality. (4) _____.

Best regards,
Karen Morris
TKN Manufacturing
This time, I will be meeting only with the top candidates to determine who is most (1) _____ for the manager position.

answer.explanation: The blank comes after "is" => use adjective

question.text: I believe you possess many of the (2) _____ we are looking for.

answer.explanation: This email is about job interview => "qualities" is the most suitable answer

question.text: (3) _____ , would a 1:00 P.M. appointment next Tuesday work for you?

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of conjunctions

question.text: Please prepare a proposal that explains how you would increase production at our plant without decreasing quality. (4) _____.
choices: (A) I would certainly be happy to write a job reference for you.
(B) My assistant will train you in your new duties.
(C) I look forward to hearing your vision for an efficient workplace.
(D) Your new product ideas were especially informative.

answer.text: (C) I look forward to hearing your vision for an efficient workplace.
answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence

question.text:
Southwestern Residences
IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT
The building's ---1--- will perform maintenance checks on the condominium's electrical circuits and switch boxes on Monday between 10 a.m. and 1 p.m. During this time, the power supply will be ---2---. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause. ---3---. However, repair work may need to be carried out if any problems are detected. ---4---, the shutdown may be extended to accommodate repairs.
For details regarding this and other related matters, please contact the building superintendent, Ms. Jena Gordon, at 555-2124. Thank you for your patience and understanding.

answer.explanation: Use possessive form " The building's administration"
Based on the meaning of words.

choices: (A) A realtor will be showing people around the building during this time.
(B) The maintenance check lasted through the weekend.
(C) We are sorry that we were unable to complete the inspection.
(D) We intend to restore electricity immediately following the inspection.

answer.text: (D) We intend to restore electricity immediately following the inspection.
answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence " We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause."
"In this case" when referring to the situation if it happened or did happen, in case "repair work may need to be carried out ..."

question.text:
October 21
Larry Mills
226 Highland Rivers
Fairbank, WA 20037

Dear Mr. Mills,
I am writing in reply to your complaint about the noise levels coming from the surrounding businesses around the apartment complex. (1) _____ , a few people living on the west wing of the building (2) _____ concern over the noise levels. The building committee has conducted meetings over this issue and we have talked to the businesses. (3) _____ . Because of this, we are also looking to fortify the windows with noise-proof glass for residences living on the west wing. Once we have agreed upon the proposals, we will post the announcement on our ulletin board and you may receive a call. Until then, we ask for your (4) _____ patience.
(1) _____ , a few people living on the west wing of the building _____ concern over the noise levels.

answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence.

question.text: _____ , a few people living on the west wing of the building (2) _____ concern over the noise levels.

answer.explanation: The subject is "a few people" => B is the right form of verb

question.text: The building committee has conducted meetings over this issue and we have talked to the businesses. (3) _____ .
choices: (A) However, some of the noises are inevitable due to the nature of the businesses.
(B) They will fully cooperate with our committee.
(C) They have responded to our concerns and will work to keep noise levels low.
(D) However, they are losing money over this matter.

answer.text: (A) However, some of the noises are inevitable due to the nature of the businesses.
answer.explanation: Based on the previous sentence: "The building committee has conducted meetings over this issue and we have talked to the businesses." but "some of the noises are inevitable due to the nature of the businesses."

question.text: Until then, we ask for your (4) _____ patience.

answer.explanation: We need an adjective to modify the noun "patience"

question.text: Thank you for shopping at Larson’s China. Our products are known for their modern and unique patterns and color combinations, as well as (1) _____ and strength. (2) _____ Please note, however, that repeated drops and rough handling will (3) _____ eventual breakage. We suggest you store them carefully and that you don’t use harsh chemicals, steel sponges, or (4) _____ scrubbing when cleaning them. Please visit our website at www.larsonchina.com for information about handling and care or call US at 555-1234 if you have any questions or concerns.
Our products are known for their modern and unique patterns and color combinations, as well as (1) _____ and strength

answer.explanation:
- as well as=> concatenating words of the same type. Because strength is a noun => requires a noun.

=> Select B: durability (durability)

question.text: (2) _____ Please note, however, that repeated drops and rough handling will _____ eventual breakage.
choices: (A) Larson’s utensils and silverware go great with the dinnerware.
(B) Our most popular line, the Spring Flower China is sold out at most locations,
(C) Visit our store to check out our other beautiful products.
(D) They are dishwasher- and microwave-safe and we’re confident that you’ll be using them for years to come.

answer.text: (D) They are dishwasher- and microwave-safe and we’re confident that you’ll be using them for years to come.
answer.explanation:
- Consider the meaning of 4 answers:
Based on the meaning of the previous sentence (introduction of durability) and the following sentence (note that if it falls many times, it will cause the row to break) => Choose answer D.

question.text: _____ Please note, however, that repeated drops and rough handling will (3) _____ eventual breakage.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text: We suggest you store them carefully and that you don’t use harsh chemicals, steel sponges, or (4) _____ scrubbing when cleaning them.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text:
From: aviera@e-last.com
To: hrniyakawa@e-last.com
Subjiect: Repair crews
Date: May 10

Dear Mr. Miyakawa,

The executive committee met this morning to discuss some complaints from our residential Internet subscribers. More and more of them are being asked to wait a week or longer for service from a repair crew. It seems that our customer base has expanded more quickly than projected, and technical support requests have increased by about 30 percent. This means that the number of technicians available to assist customers is now insuffcient.

The committee feels an expansion of the repair team is necessary to restore customer satisfaction. We are expecting even more customers to have our equipment installed in their homes, and with the present number of technical crews, we may not be able to handle their service needs. The committee has authorized you to recruit five more people who have the appropriate training.

Best regards,
Adelina Viera, Personnel Director
E-last Internet, Inc.
For whom is this message probably intended?

answer.explanation: Based on some information like: "The executive committee met this morning to discuss some complaints from our residential Internet subscribers.", "The committee has authorized you to recruit five more people who have the appropriate training."

question.text: What problem have customers been reporting?

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "More and more of them are being asked to wait a week or longer for service from a repair crew."

question.text:
To: hhollander@helensplace.com
From: customerservice@eaterysource.com
Date: January 16
Subject: Order confirmation
Dear Ms. Hollander:
Thank you for shopping with us! This e-mail confirms that we have received your order from eaterysouree.com. We are proud to be an international supplier of equipment to restaurants worldwide.
Your order is currently being processed. Orders are typically processed and sent out to our warehouses within two business days. Our staff will then begin to prepare your order for shipping. You will receive another e-mail once your order has shipped, updating you with its current tracking information.
Thank you for your business.
Regards,
The Eatery Source Team
Order Number: #19998056
Order Date: January 16
For what type of business does Ms. Hollander most likely work?

answer.explanation: In the article where the phrase "supplier of equipment to restaurants" appears => choose A

question.text: According to the e-mail, when will Ms. Hollander receive another e-mail from Eatery Source?
choices: (D)When her order has left the warehouse

answer.text: (D)When her order has left the warehouse
answer.explanation: "When your order has shipped" is equivalent to leaving the order out of stock

question.text:
From: Northern Province Electric Co.
Received: 2 August, 8:48 P.M.
Your July billing statement is now available. The balance is due by 10 August.
Please log on to our secure Web site to view your statement and account details. There you can also access your payment history, make a payment, and update your personal information and password. For assistance, call 070 2555 6416.
What is the purpose of the text message?
choices: (A) To provide notification about a bill
(D) To announce a change in the electric rate

answer.text: (A) To provide notification about a bill
answer.explanation: The main content of the message is at the very first sentence "Your July billing statement is now available" (Your July billing statement is now available). So this message is to inform about the status of the bill.

question.text: What is the recipient of the text message asked to do?

answer.explanation: The information is in the sentence “Please log on to our secure Web site to view your statement and account details” (Please log in to our secure website to view our list and details account.)

question.text: The buzz at New York’s premier book fair is all about the upcoming book from poet-turned- novelist Harry s. Tepper. The Nightingales of Fall is the eagerly awaited sequel to his best¬selling debut novel, The Swallows of spring. The book follows the journey of Sally Harknett through the weird world of Underfell, mixing social commentary with sharp wit and just a dash of magic and mystery. Tepper burst onto the scene over a decade ago with the acclaimed poetry collection, King Harmon’s Castle, and the expectation for this latest novel is another chart-topping success. Later this week, the first editions will be made available in a prize drawing at the New York Book Fair, with the official launch at major bookstores next month.
How would Mr. Tepper’s latest book most likely be classified?

answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "The book follows the journey of Sally Harknett through the weird world of Underfell, mixing social commentary with sharp wit and just a dash of magic and mystery. "

question.text: Where are copies available this week?

answer.explanation: The information is in: "Later this week, the first editions will be made available in a prize drawing at the New York Book Fair, with the official launch at major bookstores next month."

question.text:
Unsworthy Manufacturing

Date:Wednesday, October 17
Subject: Recycling

In response to pressure from local environmental groups, as of November 1 we will be separating all of our industrial waste for recycling. Collections will be made twice weekly on Tuesdays and Fridays from the regional recycling center, which will be supplying colored receptacles for different kinds of waste. All oils should be placed in the green container. All metals and glass belong in the red one. All paper waste should go into the blue one. Plastics will be collected for recycling as normal.
As this new policy also carries a financial benefit to the company, managers in all manufacturing bays are responsible for ensuring that the new protocols for waste disposal are followed, and failure to comply with the policy could result in disciplinary action.
Further information about our updated environmental practices will shortly be available on the website. Training sessions for managers will be held on Monday, October 22, but please contact me if you have any further questions in the meantime.

Regards,
Davis Jeeland
Operations Director, Unsworthy Manufacturing
What is the reason for the change?
choices: (A) The company owners want to save money on labor.
(B) A new recycling center opened near the business.
(C) The local government changed its regulations.
(D) Environmentalists in the area requested it

answer.text: (D) Environmentalists in the area requested it
answer.explanation: The information is in: "In response to pressure from local environmental groups"

question.text: What can be inferred about Unsworthy Manufacturing?
choices: (A) It has good relations with local authorities.
(B) It already recycles its plastic industrial waste.
(D) It updates its environmental policy regularly.

answer.text: (B) It already recycles its plastic industrial waste.
answer.explanation: The information is in: "All oils should be placed in the green container. All metals and glass belong in the red one. All paper waste should go into the blue one. Plastics will be collected for recycling as normal."

question.text: What should supervisors do next week?
choices: (A) Attend a workshop on new procedures
(C) Make room for new waste receptacles
(D) Inform their teams of the changes

answer.text: (A) Attend a workshop on new procedures
answer.explanation: It can be inferredfrom: "Training sessions for managers will be held on Monday, October 22"

question.text:
*Email*


To: Staff@holmana.co.uk
From: Robin Ruiz, Facilities Manager
Date: 12 October
Subject: New Desks

Dear staff,

We will soon be replacing all employee desks with new hybrid ones that will allow you to work while either seated or standing. The new desks are due to arrive on 20 October. --- [1] ---. I have requested that the delivery occur early in the morning before office hours so it does not interrupt our work. --- [2] ---. To make the transition go faster, please move the contents of your current desk, including personal items, into a cardboard box on the 19th.
You can read more about the model we've ordered at wilsonofficefurniture.com/hybrid56. --- [3] ---. My research showed this one to be the most user-friendly option. The height of the desk can be changed by simply flipping a latch and pushing a button.
Many of you have been requesting hybrid desks for some time now, so I am glad we are able to make this happen. This is only one of the changes management plans to implement this year in our efforts to make Holmana a healthier and happier workplace. --- [4] ---.

Best regards,
Robin Ruiz
How can employees help prepare for a delivery?
choices: (C) By completing their work in the morning
(D) By moving furniture out of their offices

answer.explanation: Sign: "To make the transition go faster, please move the contents of your current desk"

question.text: Why has the desk been chosen?
choices: (A) It has a large storage area.
(D) It is the cheapest option available.

answer.explanation: Sign: "My research showed this one to be the most user-friendly option"

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3] and [4] does the following sentence best belong?
"Any other ideas you have for us are welcome."

answer.explanation: Sign: "This is only one of the changes management plans to implement this year in our efforts to make Holmana a healthier and happier workplace."

question.text:
Submission Guidelines


Maple Leaf Literary Journal, the most widely circulated literary magazine in Canada, has published fiction by some of the most well-known writers in the country. We are now inviting new writers to submit short stories for publication.

Submitted stories should be carefully proofread and should conform to our editing criteria. These can be accessed at www.mapleleaflj.ca/submissions/stylesheet.

Submissions are accepted in the form of e-mail attachments only, sent to our Editorial Office at submissions@mapleleaflj.org.ca. Please include a cover letter and a brief summary of the piece (listing major events in the story’s plot, main characters’ names, etc.). When the editors have finished reviewing the submission, they will notify you as to whether it will be published. Notification can he expected within six months of submission. Please do not contact the Editorial Office for review results.

Writers whose stories are published will be compensated at the rate of $20 for each page as the story appears in the final print layout of the magazine.
What is suggested about the magazine?
choices: (B)It sells more copies than its competitors.

answer.text: (B)It sells more copies than its competitors.
answer.explanation: Information in the sentence "Maple Leaf Literary Journal, the most widely circulated literary magazine in Canada"

question.text: What should accompany each submission?

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence "Please include a cover letter and a brief summary of the piece (listing major events in the story’s plot, main characters’ names, etc.)."

question.text: What will authors receive if their pieces are chosen?
choices: (C)A free copy of the next magazine issue

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence "Writers whose stories are published will be compensated at the rate of $20 for each page as the story appears in the final print layout of the magazine."

question.text: From Coins to Credit: Banking Throughout the Ages is a concise history of banks and the banking industry from ancient times to the present. James Gallagher, who has made a career of covering financial news for several newspapers, has done a careful job of investigating his subject Although he presents the facts carefully, Mr. Gallagher has made what could have been a dry book into one that is interesting and enjoyable. By telling amusing anecdotes about historical figures, he makes them come alive. Even people who are not particularly attracted to the subject matter will find this book engrossing.
What most likely is Mr. Gallagher’s job?

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: " James Gallagher, who has made a career of covering financial news for several newspapers"

question.text: What does the reviewer NOT mention about the book?

answer.explanation:
" interesting and enjoyable" => Eliminate B
"By telling amusing anecdotes about historical figures" => Eliminate C
"careful job of investigating" => Elimiante D

question.text: The word “dry” in line 5 is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer.

question.text: What does the reviewer suggest?
choices: (A)Most people are not interested in history.
(B)The banking industry is in a state of chaos.
(D)The book will appeal to different groups of people.

answer.text: (D)The book will appeal to different groups of people.
answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "Even people who are not particularly attracted to the subject matter will find this book engrossing."

question.text:
(Man) - [1] - I remember when Sergio Hernandez first came to work here at Trout & Lee. He was a young man of thirty with a heart and mind filled with ambition and drive. - [2] - It is that ambition and drive, along with a lot of integrity and intelligence, that made him one of the most valuable players in the garment business and US one of the most successful companies.
- [3] - I can’t help but remember how emotional I was when I left the company to pursue a life of leisure last year. - [4] - I know the speech Serg. gave then came back to help me during the difficult transition into living without an office to go to and colleagues to be continually inspired by, and I hope the few humble words I’ve strung together will remind him of how well-respected he is and what an astounding life he has lived as he goes through the same process

In which of the marked positions [1], [2], [3], or [4] does this sentence best belong?
“I feel it a great honor to be asked to speak about him here today.”

answer.explanation: This sentence must be said before entering the main part of a speech. So that means it will be at position [3]

question.text: What is indicated about Trout & Lee?
choices: (B) It is a real estate company.
(C) It has manufacturing plants in the U.S.
(D) It has existed for many decades.

answer.text: (D) It has existed for many decades.
answer.explanation: When Hernandez first arrived at the company, he was 30 years old. Now that he is retired, then it can be inferred that this company has been in existence for several decades.

question.text: What is implied about Mr. Hernandez?
choices: (A) He is the CEO of Trout & Lee.
(C) He is transferring to a new department.
(D) He is retiring from the company.

answer.text: (D) He is retiring from the company.
answer.explanation: "leisure life" mentioned in the passage means retirement. Then "as he goes through the same process" (when he goes through the same process) means he will also retire.

question.text: What is NOT mentioned about Mr. Hernandez?
choices: (A) When he started working for the company
(B) The type of employee he was
(C) The type of industry he worked in

answer.explanation:
Using the exclusion method, it can be seen that only information in option D is not mentioned.
Alternative A: I remember when Sergio Hernandez first came to work here at Trout & Lee. He was a young man of thirty ”Option B:" made him one of the most valuable players "
Option C: “in the garment business”

question.text:
Crockett Center for Community Dewetopment
28 Freeney Avenue
Austin, TX 73301



May 16

Dathan Shaw, Urban Outreach Director
Integral Harvest
184 Van Buren Street
Denver, CO 80210

Dear Mr. Shaw:

I enjoyed our meeting last week. I know of no other non-profit organization that performs such a vital service for all-natural agriculture as yours does, and I am enthusiastic about the prospect of the Crocket Center working with Integral Harvest.

As you know, the Crockett Center has recently turned its attention to urban gardening. On this front, the main priorities are to expand existing community gardens in Austin and to found new ones in neighborhoods currently lacking them. Therefore, I would like to proceed with the gardening classes we discussed in our meeting, to be taught on-site by Integral Harvest representatives and attended by Austin community residents. If you will let me know your representatives' availability for teaching the classes and also the range of topics they will cover, I can prepare a class schedule and generate interest in it among residents. My assistant, Cindy Reed, will call you shortly for this information.

As for your proposal that Integral Harvest representatives demonstrate organic gardening to elementary school students here in Austin, since our meeting I have spoken with several school administrators. It seems that a number of the schools have gardening clubs, so students and teachers alike should make a receptive audience. Let us discuss this proposal further in our next meeting, which Ms. Reed will schedule.

I am sure that, if our two organizations work together, we can do much to promote urban gardening as a rewarding and healthful endeavor.

Yours sincerely,

Letitia Price, Executive Director
Crockett Center for Community Development
What is the purpose of the letter?
choices: (A)To arrange a joint project between two organizations
(C)To provide a schedule of gardening classes
(D)To finalize a merger of two organizations

answer.text: (A)To arrange a joint project between two organizations
answer.explanation: Based on the information given in: "I know of no other non-profit organization that performs such a vital service for all-natural agriculture as yours does, and I am enthusiastic about the prospect of the Crocket Center working with Integral Harvest."

question.text: What is stated as one of the Crockett Center's goals?
choices: (B)To increase attendance at gardening club meetings

answer.explanation: The information is in: "On this front, the main priorities are to expand existing community gardens in Austin and to found new ones in neighborhoods currently lacking them."

question.text: What subject was most likely discussed when Mr. Shaw and Ms. Price met?
choices: (C)A government proposal to build new schools

answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "Therefore, I would like to proceed with the gardening classes we discussed in our meeting, to be taught on-site by Integral Harvest representatives and attended by Austin community residents."

question.text: Why will Ms. Reed contact Mr. Shaw?
choices: (A)To give him contact information for school administrators
(B)To postpone a meeting until the following week
(D)To ask him about a new gardening method

answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "As for your proposal that Integral Harvest representatives demonstrate organic gardening to elementary school students here in Austin, since our meeting I have spoken with several school administrators. It seems that a number of the schools have gardening clubs, so students and teachers alike should make a receptive audience. Let us discuss this proposal further in our next meeting, which Ms. Reed will schedule."

question.text:
Kenneth Global Journalism Internship

The Kenneth Global Journalism Internship will provide you with great opportunities to train with the world's most renowned international multimedia news agency, work with professional reporters and editors, and gain valuable experiences in fast-paced newsrooms in big cities such as London, Berlin, and Paris. It will offer talented college graduates an opportunity to learn and develop their journalistic skills and first-hand knowledge.

This is a paid internship that offers free lodging as well as lunch and dinner. Interns will receive several weeks of formal training focused on writing skills, journalism ethics, and basic workplace knowledge. They are also able to take advantage of other regularly scheduled training opportunities during the internship free of charge. The internship will last 4 months, beginning on August 1.

Applications for the internship can be found on our website at www,kennethglobal.com and must be submitted by June 20. Applicants who advance past this stage will be asked to interview at our headquarters on June 27. Any questions can be directed toward Ruby Hart at rubyhart@kennethglobal.com or asked in person at our headquarter in Austin.

===========================

From: Kyle Lane kylelane12@mpnet.com
To: Ruby Hart rubyhart@kennethglobal.com
Subject: Internship
Date: June 28

Dear Ms. Hart,
I am extremely grateful to have advanced past the first round of the Kenneth Global Journalism Internship's selection process. Applicants are supposed to interview in person on the specified date, but unfortunately I am scheduled to attend an important conference in Dallas with my professor. However, because I live in the same city as your headquarters, it Would not be difficult to arrange an alternative time for me to interview.
Thanks again for considering me for this position. I look forward to hearing back from you concerning a possible interview date. In the meantime, I will do my best to prepare myself.

Regards,
Kyle Lane
What is indicated about internship applicants?
choices: (A) They must have prior work experience.
(B) They must attend an upcoming conference.
(C) They must submit a letter ofrecommendation.
(D) They must hold a bachelor’s degree.

answer.text: (D) They must hold a bachelor’s degree.
answer.explanation: "It will offer an opportunity to talented college Graduates learn and develop skills and journalistic có first hand knowledge."

question.text: What is true about the internship?
choices: (B) It is for professional journalists only.

answer.explanation: “This is a paid intership that offers free lodging as well as lunch and dinner.”

question.text: What other benefit is offered to interns?

answer.explanation: “Interns will receive several weeks of formal training focused on writing skills, journalist ethics, and basic workplace knowledge. They are also able to take advantage of other regularly scheduled training opportunities during the internship free of charge ”.

question.text: When is Mr.Lane supposed to attend an interview?

answer.explanation: “Applicants who advance past this stage will be asked to interview at our headquarters on June 27.”

question.text: Where does Mr. Lane live?

answer.explanation:
- “I live in the same city as your headquarters”.         

- “Any questions can be directed toward Ruby Hart at  rubyhart@kennethglobal.com  or asked in person at our headquarters in Austin”.

question.text:
To: Dennis Maki
From: Nigella Smith
Date: Thursday, November 8,2:15 P.M.
Subject: Update
Dennis:

The heads of accounting and sales have chosen the finalists for the job openings in their departments here at Plumsted Aynes. Susan Tsai would like to invite Marco Garcia and Danielle Jenkins to return for second interviews for the accounting position, and Rajesh Kapoor wants to invite Melanie Yu for a second interview for the medical sales position.
 
I would like you to call the finalists, schedule interviews with them, and then make lunch arrangements accordingly. Keep in mind that Susan will be out of the office next week for  a conference.
 
Thank you for your assistance with this search so far. I’m especially grateful that you were able to work on a short deadline when I asked you to set up the initial interviews.
Regards,
Nigella Smith
Human Resources Director
 

=========================
To: Nigella Smith
From: Dennis Maki 
Date: Thursday, November 8,3:52 P.M.
Subject: RE: Update

Nigella:

I called the three finalists. As it turns out, this afternoon Melanie Yu accepted a job offer with another pharmaceutical firm—our competitor Granquist. I informed Rajesh about this development and he said he hopes to find a suitable replacement.
 
I have confirmed an interview for Mr. Garcia on Tuesday, November 20. I also made arrangements with our regular catering company for lunch here. Unfortunately, Ms. Jenkins was recently hospitalized, so I’m leaving any further decision  about her interview  with you.
 
Dennis Maki
Administrative Associate
What is one purpose of the first e-mail?
choices: (B)To make an offer to a job applicant

answer.explanation: The first email, paragraph 2: I would like you to call the finalists, ...

question.text: What type of company most likely is Plumsted Aynes?

answer.explanation: The second email, paragraph 1, line 1: .... a job offer with ANOTHER pharmaceutical firm - our COMPETITOR Granquist

question.text: What is suggested about Ms. Jenkins?
choices: (B)She will be interviewed by Ms. Smith.
(D)She is interested in a sales position.

answer.explanation: 1 st email, paragraph 1, line 3: .... big Danielle Jenkins RETURN for second interviews...

question.text: What will Mr. Kapoor most likely do?

answer.explanation: 2 nd email, paragraph 1, last sentence: ..he said he hopes to find a suitable replacement.

question.text: What was Mr. Maki NOT able to do?
choices: (B)Schedule all the appointments within a given time frame
(D)Assist Ms. Smith with setting up the initial interviews

answer.text: (B)Schedule all the appointments within a given time frame
answer.explanation:
2 nd email, paragraph 2:

- Mr. Garcia: Tuesday November 20 

- Catering company for lunch 

- Ms. Jenkins: hospitalized => unable to 'close' all appointments on 1 time frame

question.text:
To:Bountiful Harvest info@bountifulharvest.com
From:Emily Hall emilyhall@zipline.com
Date:June 3
Subject: Food Delivery

To whom it may concern,

My name is Emily Hall and I am the owner of a vegetarian restaurant located in downtown Huntsville. I am contacting you because I am interested in receiving regular shipments of fresh, organic vegetables to my restaurant weekly. My restaurant is just starting, so I do not need a large quantity of goods. After looking into different farms in the area, I chose to contact Bountiful Harvest because of your promise to deliver certified organic food. Therefore, I would like to receive a price estimate for the cost of having fresh vegetables delivered directly to our restaurant on a weekly basis.

Emily Hall

==========================

To:Emily Hall emilyhall@zipline.com
From:Bountiful Harvest info@bountifulharvest.com
Date:June 4
Subject:RE: Food Delivery

Dear Ms. Hall,

Thanks for contacting our farm. At Bountiful Harvest, we offer fresh organic produce that can be delivered directly to a customer’s location on a regular basis. Our vegetables are harvested from the field and delivered immediately, which means that you are getting wholesome, nutritious, organic produce to serve at your restaurant. We also offer additional items such as fresh meat, cheese, and milk. Below is a table detailing the various pricing options we offer.

Package Option Features Weight Delivery Frequency Price Per Delivery
Personal This package feeds approximately 2-3 people and contains fresh seasonal vegetables 5 lb Once a week $15
Small This package is ideal for small businesses and includes fresh seasonal vegetables. 50 lb Once a week $140
Medium This package is for medium-sized businesses needing a constant supply of fresh vegetables and meats. 130 lb Twice a week $500
Large This package is our largest package and includes vegetables, meats, and dairy products. 250 lb Twice a week $800


The prices listed above do not include the delivery price. Customers who do not pick up their packages in person will have to pay an extra $6 per package to be delivered. However, for customers who sign up for an entire year’s worth of deliveries, we will deliver your package for free. The purchase of additional items will also affect the final price of your package. Additional options are available on our website. Payments can be made via cash, credit card, check, or money order on the day of delivery.

We know that our customers especially care about the quality of the food. Therefore, we offer a mini package free of charge so you can assess our food. Please call Greg Lemons at 555-8141 to take advantage of this opportunity.

Indira Singh

===========================

To: Bountiful Harvest info@bountifulharvest.com
From: Emily Hall emilyhall@zipline.com
Date: June 5
Subject: Harvest Schedule

Dear Ms. Singh,

Thank you for responding so promptly to my email. I appreciate the offer of the complimentary delivery, but I think I would like to just go ahead and set up regular deliveries. I may be interested in setting up a year’s worth of deliveries, but I would first like to get a list of the range of produce that you will be offering through the different seasons. As I own a vegetarian restaurant, I will need to have an idea of the types of produce that will be delivered so I can prepare my menus accordingly. Thank you so much for your consideration, and I look forward to working with Bountiful Harvest!

Kind regards,
Emily Hall
What is the purpose of the first e-mail?
choices: (B) To inquire about a policy change

answer.explanation: “Therefore, I would like to receive a price estimate for the cost of having fresh vegetables delivered directly to our restaurant on a weekly basis.”

question.text: Why does Emily Hall want to know about the vegetables that will be available throughout the year?
choices: (B) She is thinking about adding meat.
(D) She wants to plan her future menus

answer.text: (D) She wants to plan her future menus
answer.explanation: “I will need to have an idea of the types of produce that will be delivered so I can prepare my menus accordingly”

question.text: What information is not needed for a final price?

answer.explanation:
By the exclusion method, it can be seen that only information in option C was not mentioned.
Option A: for customers who sign up for an entire year's worth of deliveries, we will deliver your package for free ”
Option B:“ Customers who do not pick their packages in person will have to pay an extra $ 6 per package to be delivered '
Option C “The purchase of additional items will also affect the final price of your package”

question.text: What package option most likely fits Ms. Hall’s needs best?

answer.explanation:
“My restaurant is just starting” and “having fresh vegetables delivered directly to our restaurant on a weekly basis”.
The optional package that covers these most is the Small package.

question.text: What is indicated in Emily Hall’s e-mail?
choices: (A) She wants to try it for a month.
(C) She is interested in a long-term contract.

answer.text: (C) She is interested in a long-term contract.
answer.explanation:
“I appreciate the offer of the complimentary delivery”
“I may be interested in setting up a year's worth of deliveries”

question.text:
From:Henry Choi - henrychoi@neatsolutions.com
To: Jenny Davis - jennydavis@tmgolf.com
Date: August 8
Subject: Endless Acres Golf Club
Attachment: draft

Dear Ms. Davis,
Attached is the newest draft of the advertisement for Endless Acres Golf Club. I have incorporated the advertising slogan you sent me into my design. I used a combination of eye-catching graphics to grab the attention of newspaper readers. I also added some helpful information to the end of the advertisement. Please let me know if the design and new additions meet your expectations. Along with the concurrent television ad, I think this advertisement will help bring a lot of new customers to Endless Acres Golf Club.
Sincerely,
Henry Choi

==========================

Endless Acres Golf Club

1232 Hilly Meadows Drive, Mapleview, CO

Take a break from all the stress of life and play a round of relaxing golf at Endless Acres Golf Club. After a game of golf, enjoy a meal at our restaurant in a sophisticated and welcoming environment.
We are currently offering the following promotion:
Reserve a tee time for a party of seven or more golfers and receive 20% off. Additionally, every member of your group will receive a coupon for $5 off any purchase from our golf shop.
We were recently praised by The Rolling Meadows Daily for the superb maintenance of our golf course and grounds. Come in and enjoy the best golf course in the state of Colorado. We are located off exit 21 on Highway 5. Just look for our billboard. You can't miss it!
Reservations can now be made online at our website at www.endlessacresgolf. com or by calling 555-4834.

===========================

From: Logan Mankins - lmankins@crushing.com
To: reservations@endlessacresgolfclub.com
Date: July 6
Subject: Re: Tee Time and Dinner for 10

Hello,
I saw your ad in the newspaper and I have a couple quick questions about your deals. First, we have a group of ten golfers. Now I know most courses generally limit a group to four players to keep up the pace of play, but I was really hoping you could make an exception for us and allow two groups of five. We will even rent golf carts to ensure that we don’t cause a delay. As for the $5 gift cards to the pro shop, I was wondering if they could be pooled together for one large purchase. It is my son’s birthday and I would like to buy him a new putter and they are awfully expensive these days. $50 bucks could go a long way to giving him a great gift!
We would like to tee off around 11:30 A.M. on Saturday, July 20th, and then have dinner there at about 6:00 P.M. Please write back to confirm our tee time and answer my queries. Thank you for your time!
Have a great day,
Logan Mankins
What has been added to the advertisement?

answer.explanation:
In the first email, there is write “I also added some helpful information to the end of the advertisement.”
“Reservations can now be made online at our website at www.endlessacresgolf. com or by calling 555-4834.

question.text: How does Logan Mankins propose to keep his two groups of 5 golfers from delaying the other golfers on the course?
choices: (A) He guarantees they will play fast.
(B) He promises that they are very good at golf.
(C) He writes that he will buy a new putter for his son.
(D) He informs the club that the two groups will be driving golf carts.

answer.text: (D) He informs the club that the two groups will be driving golf carts.
answer.explanation: Information: “We will rent golf cart to ensure that we don't cause a delay”

question.text: What did The Rolling Meadows Daily indicate about Endless Acres Golf Club?
choices: (D) The restaurant updates its menu regularly.

answer.explanation: The information is located at the beginning of paragraph 3 of the article “We were recently praised by The Rolling Meadows Daily for the superb maintenance Of our golf course and grounds”

question.text: What does Logan Mankins want to do with the $5 credit the members get for the golf shop?
choices: (A) He wants to buy his son a putter with his.
(B) He wants to use them to pay for green fees.
(C) He wants to combine it with the 20% group discount.
(D) He wants to combine all of the discounts together and apply it to one purchase.

answer.text: (D) He wants to combine all of the discounts together and apply it to one purchase.
answer.explanation: The information is in the sentence "About the $ 5 voucher at the store, I wonder if they can be combined for one big purchase."

question.text: Where would the advertisement most likely appear?

answer.explanation: You can infer from the first sentence of the email "I see your ad on the newspaper"

question.text:
Long-Awaited Sequel Has Arrived
(June 2) — David Mendoza's eagerly anticipated sequel to the best-selling Waking Up is finally here. The much loved Waking Up chronicled the ups and downs Mendoza experienced as he moved from job to job as a youth, working as everything from dock worker and fisherman, to hotel clerk and tennis
instructor. Life Lessons in Advertising picks up where the previous book left off, with Mendoza having just arrived in New York City. We follow his rise from mailroom clerk to the head of M&D Creative, a highly successful advertising agency.
Written in the humorous, informal style that has made Mendoza's ads so successful over the years, the book shares stories of client case histories and reveals how he developed his most successful advertisements. The book is now available online and in bookstores everywhere.

=================
Book Review: Life Lessons in Advertising
By Julia Turnbull
Given that it took twenty years for David Mendoza d to write his second book, Life Lessons in Advertising, the impression the reader is left with at the end is that he forgot to edit his work. While 1 thoroughly enjoyed Mendoza’s previous book, this sequel is made up of dull, complicated sentences that make reading a chore. There’s no argument regarding his abilities as an advertising executive, yet the anecdotes about life in the advertising business arc so much less engaging than those earlier stories that almost jumped off the pages. For example, nothing matches the earlier book’s crystal clear descriptions of his escapades and unexpected adventures as a hotel clerk in northern Montana. This is one book you can skip.
=================
Advertising in Motion Magazine
A minute with...
Advertising guru David Mendoza

AIMM: Why did it take you so long to write this book?
Mendoza: It's funny. I've always considered my copywriting to be my strength. But long pieces of writing, like manuscripts, are very difficult for me, so 1 take my time to edit them carefully. But I'm very proud of the end result-—it's easy to read and highly enjoyable, just like my first book.
AIMM: You've held so many jobs, like fisherman and tennis instructor. Why do you think advertising stuck?
Mendoza: I'm not so sure it did really stick, although I've been with it for a while. My philosophy is to be open to any opportunity that comes my way. Advertising came my way, but I'm rather sure it's not the last thing I'll try my hand at And you never know, 1 might go back to fishing or tennis.
In the article, the phrase "picks up" in paragraph 2, line 1, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: "Life Lessons in Advertising picks up where the previous book left off". In this context, "pick up" means "continue after a break".

question.text: What is indicated about Waking Up?
choices: (A)  It was published twenty years ago.
(B)  It has been made into a movie.

answer.text: (A)  It was published twenty years ago.
answer.explanation: The information for this question is in the commentary on the book. Even in the first sentence it is said that the author took 20 years to write the second book. From here it can be deduced that the first book (Walking up) was published 20 years ago.

question.text: In the book review, what is suggested about Mr. Mendoza's time as a hotel clerk?
choices: (D)  He wrote stories in the evenings.

answer.explanation: ‘His escapades and unexpected adventures as a hotel clerk’

question.text: On what point do Mr. Mendoza and Ms. Turnbull disagree?
choices: (A)  Mr. Mendoza's effectiveness as an advertising executive
(B)  Mr. Mendoza's attitude toward reading for pleasure
(C)  The reason Waking Up is popular
(D)  The quality of the writing in Life Lessons in Advertising

answer.text: (D)  The quality of the writing in Life Lessons in Advertising
answer.explanation: As can be seen in the commentary, the Turnbull article says “This sequel made up of dull, complicated sentences that made reading a chore” (this next volume is made up of complicated, stupid sentences that make reading become a tiring job). Meanwhile, Mr. Mendoza said in the interview "I'm proud of the end result." It's easy to read and highly enjoyable ”

question.text: What does Mr. Mendoza imply in the interview transcript?
choices: (A)  He is looking for a new publisher.
(B)  He has recently bought a new fishing boat.
(C)  He learned the most from his job as a tennis instructor.
(D)  He may change his profession again.

answer.text: (D)  He may change his profession again.
answer.explanation: “I am rather sure it’s not the last thing I’ll try my hand at”
